Assay.description:
[OBI, OBI:0000070, assay] A planned process that has the objective to produce information
about a material entity by examining it.

id.description: The id property uniquely identifies the object.
id.title: Id

created_by_ref.description: The id property of the data-provider who created the object.
created_by_ref.title: Created By Ref

tag_list.description: Key-value tags related to the object.
tag_list.title: Tag List

external_reference_list.description: External references related to the object.
external_reference_list.title: External Reference List

url_list.description: URL list related to the object.
url_list.title: Url List

repository_identifier.description: An assay identifier that uniquely identifies the assay in repository.
repository_identifier.title: Repository Identifier

name.description: Name of the assay. It SHOULD be unique in a study.
name.title: Name

protocol_refs.description: The id properties of protocols used in assay. A protocol is a defined and standardized procedure followed to collect, prepare, or analyze biological samples.
protocol_refs.title: Protocol Refs

DerivedDataFile.description:
[MS, MS:1003084, processed data file]
File that contains data that has been substantially processed or
transformed from what was originally acquired by an instrument.

id.description: The id property uniquely identifies the object.
id.title: Id

type.description: The type property identifies type of the object
type.title: Type

created_by_ref.description: The id property of the data-provider who created the object.
created_by_ref.title: Created By Ref

tag_list.description: Key-value tags related to the object.
tag_list.title: Tag List

external_reference_list.description: External references related to the object.
external_reference_list.title: External Reference List

url_list.description: URL list related to the object.
url_list.title: Url List

name.description: Name of the file. File MUST be a file (not folder or link).It MAY be relative path (e.g., FILES/study.txt) or a file in a compressed file (e.g., FILES/study.zip#data/metadata.tsv).
name.title: Name

size.description: The size of the file in bytes, representing the total amount of data contained in the file.
size.title: Size

hash_sha256.description: The SHA-256 cryptographic hash of the file content, used to verify file integrity and ensure that the file has not been altered.
hash_sha256.title: Hash Sha256

format_ref.description: The structure or encoding used to store the contents of the file, typically indicated by its extension (e.g., .txt, .csv, .mzML, .raw, etc.).
format_ref.title: Format Ref

compression_format_refs.description: The structure or encoding used to compress the contents of the file, typically indicated by its extension (e.g., .zip, .tar, .gz, etc.). List item order shows order of compressions. e.g. [tar format, gzip format] for tar.gz
compression_format_refs.title: Compression Format Refs

extension.description: The extension of file. It MUST contain all extensions (e.g., .raw, .mzML, .d.zip, .raw.zip, etc.).
extension.title: Extension

DerivedDataFile.title: DerivedDataFile

Metabolite.description:
Any intermediate or product resulting from metabolism.
The term 'metabolite' subsumes the classes commonly known as primary and secondary metabolites. [CHEBI, CHEBI:25212, metabolite]

RawDataFile.description:
[MS, MS:1003083, raw data file]
Data file that contains original data as generated by an instrument,
although not necessarily in the original data format
(i.e. an original raw file converted to a different format is still a raw data file)
